A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Best Star Wars movie since Empire Strikes Back. Finally\, they've got subtext without opposition\, complexity in the relationship between Crime/Rebellion/Empire\, complexity in the Jedi/Sith\, complexity in what it means to be a hero\, a story that embraces the spirit of the originals while simultaneously forging it's own path\, and a story of corruption seen all the way through.\n\nIt sometimes feels like I just saw a different movie than everyone. I'm a huge fan too (not of the prequels as much\, but I still enjoy them for popcorn flicks.) But the broader universe? Clone Wars\, all the games\, the RPGs\, the MMO\, Rebels\, the extended universe? I'm a fan. This movie has depth\, nuance\, and complexity. It reminded me of being young\, watching the original Star Wars\, and remembering all the questions it raised.
